User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Blur Identity application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

anonymousId.description: Anonymous identifier for the user, generated by Firebase.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

upvotes.description: Total number of upvotes the user profile has received.

upvotedBy.description: An array of user IDs that have upvoted this user.

status.description: The status of the user's account.

blockedUsers.description: An array of user IDs that this user has blocked.

mutedUsers.description: An array of user IDs that this user has muted.

restrictedUsers.description: An array of user IDs that this user has restricted.

PollOption.title: Poll Option
PollOption.description: Represents a single option in a poll.

option.description: The text of the poll option.

votes.description: The number of votes for this option.

Post.title: Post
Post.description: Represents a user-generated text post, which can optionally be a poll.

id.description: Unique identifier for the post entity.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the post was created.

authorId.description: Reference to the User who created the post.

content.description: The text content of the post.

likes.description: An array of user IDs that have liked the post.

likeCount.description: The total number of likes for the post.

commentCount.description: The total number of comments on the post.

commentsAllowed.description: Indicates if comments are allowed on this post.

pollOptions.description: An array of poll options, if the post is a poll.

voters.description: A map of user IDs to the index of the option they voted for, to prevent multiple votes.

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description: Represents a comment on a post.

postId.description: The ID of the post this comment belongs to.

authorId.description: The ID of the user who wrote the comment.

content.description: The text content of the comment.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the comment was created.

status.description: The status of the comment, used for the restrict feature.

Bookmark.title: Bookmark
Bookmark.description: Represents a user's bookmark of a post.

postId.description: The ID of the bookmarked post.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the bookmark was created.

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: Represents a notification for a user about an activity.

postId.description: The ID of the post the activity is related to.

postContent.description: A snippet of the content of the post.

fromUserId.description: The ID of the user who initiated the activity.

read.description: Whether the user has read the notification.

Conversation.title: Conversation
Conversation.description: Represents a direct message conversation between two or more users.

unreadCounts.description: A map of user IDs to the number of unread messages they have.

lastReadTimestamps.description: A map of user IDs to the timestamp of their last read message.

mutedBy.description: An array of user IDs who have muted this conversation.

lockedBy.description: An array of user IDs who have locked this conversation.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a single message within a conversation.

Report.title: Report
Report.description: Represents a report filed by a user against another user.

definition.description: Stores user profiles. This path uses the Firebase Auth UID as the document ID.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, corresponding to the Firebase Auth UID.

definition.description: Stores a user's bookmarked posts. The document ID is the ID of the post being bookmarked.

params.name: userId
params.description: The ID of the user who owns the bookmarks.

params.name: postId
params.description: The ID of the bookmarked post.

params.name: userId
params.description: The ID of the user receiving the notification.

params.name: notificationId
params.description: The unique ID for the notification.

definition.description: Stores all user posts in a global collection. Any authenticated user can read all posts, but can only create, update, or delete their own.

params.name: postId
params.description: The unique identifier for the post.

definition.description: Stores comments for a specific post. This is a subcollection of a post document.

params.name: postId
params.description: The ID of the parent post.

params.name: commentId
params.description: The unique identifier for the comment.

definition.description: Stores metadata about a direct message conversation. The document ID is a composite of the participant UIDs.

params.name: conversationId
params.description: The unique identifier for the conversation.

definition.description: Stores all messages for a given conversation in a subcollection.

params.name: conversationId
params.description: The ID of the parent conversation.

params.name: messageId
params.description: The unique identifier for the message.

definition.description: Stores user-generated reports for content moderation.

params.name: reportId
params.description: The unique identifier for the report.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed for a public, social-media-style application. User profiles are stored in a `/users` collection, while all posts are stored in a single top-level `/posts` collection. This global `posts` collection allows any user to easily query and view all public posts. Security rules are configured to enforce that while all authenticated user can read posts, only the original author (`authorId` must match `request.auth.uid`) can write, update, or delete their own posts. Comments are stored in a subcollection under each post for clear organization. User-specific data like bookmarks and notifications are stored in subcollections under the respective user's document for security and scalability. Messaging is handled through a top-level `conversations` collection, with messages stored in a subcollection. This allows for efficient querying of conversations a user is part of, while keeping the actual message data separate. A `reports` collection is added for moderation purposes, allowing users to report content or other users.
